executable.title: Resample Anisotropy
executable.description: This program will resample a floating point image using either the Rigid or B-Spline transform. You may want to save the aligned B0 image after each of the anisotropy map co-registration steps with the anatomical image to check the registration quality with another tool.
executable.acknowledgements: Funding for this version of the GTRACT program was provided by NIH/NINDS R01NS050568-01A2S1
executable.contributor: This tool was developed by Vincent Magnotta and Greg Harris.

parameters.label: Input Parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for specifying the anisotropy image, the transform filename, the transform type, and the anatomical image (whose characteristics will be cloned).

image.name: inputAnisotropyVolume
image.description: Required: input file containing the anisotropy image
image.label: Input Anisotropy Image Volume

image.name: inputAnatomicalVolume
image.description: Required: input file containing the anatomical image whose characteristics will be cloned.
image.label: Input Anatomical Image Volume

transform.name: inputTransform
transform.description: Required: input Rigid OR Bspline transform file name
transform.label: Input Transform

parameters.label: Output File
parameters.description: Output file from resampling the input 3D float image

image.name: outputVolume
image.description: Required: name of output NRRD file containing the resampled transformed anisotropy image.
image.label: Output Anisotropy Image Volume

integer.name: numberOfThreads
integer.label: Number Of Threads
integer.description: Explicitly specify the maximum number of threads to use.
